title: What chemical or combination of chemicals can melt steel? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thermite welding is the best known I’d say - that’s used to join sections of continuously welded rail on railway tracks: Exothermic welding - Wikipedia Uses aluminium metal powder and iron (III) oxide (2:3 ratio, plus suitably high temperatures to kick-start the reaction) to weld sections of steel rails together. A magnesium ribbon fuse or propane torch is normally used to ignite the thermite, which then burns at temperatures high enough to weld the two rail ends together.
Oxygen and acetylene in a cutting torch, coke and compressed air in a blast furnace are examples unless you mean without using the chemicals to create lots of heat.
